bio: G. Daniel Bruch is a distinguished member of the Philadelphia Office’s Toxic Tort department, dedicating his practice to the defense of complex claims involving environmental and occupational exposure—including from lead, PCB, benzene, asbestos, silica and pesticides. He has successfully represented dozens of clients—from small, family-owned businesses to major, multinational corporations—in high-stakes toxic tort matters throughout Pennsylvania. With almost five decades of experience, Mr. Bruch brings exceptional judgement and deep institutional knowledge to every case he handles. His career reflects a lifelong commitment to excellence, integrity, and professionalism.

Mr. Bruch graduated with honors from Villanova University with a degree in Economics. He served in the United States Navy as a Lieutenant Junior Grade from 1970 to 1973, then returned to Villanova University’s School of Law to earn his J.D.

Mr. Bruch is a member of the Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and American Bar Associations, as well as the Toxic Tort Committee of the Pennsylvania Defense Institute. Beyond his defense practice, he is often called upon to serve as an arbitrator for the Manville Personal Injury Trust and UNR Asbestos Disease Claim Trust, demonstrating his reputation for fairness and expertise in mass tort settlements and claims administration.
